page.title: 09MARLAND SCHOOL
page.content: Marland School, a private special school, listed by the D.E.S. and founded in 1967 is housed in the old Vicarage Farm. The buildings have been considerably extended with the addition of several classrooms, hobbies rooms, a mini-gym, boarding facilities, common rooms, kitchen and dining room. There are 48 boys, all boarders aged from 11_16, mostly from Devon but all supported by their L.E.As. The boys are educationally backward and have behaviour problems due to severe emotional disturbances in earlier years. A staff of 32 adults,10 of whom are teachers (some part time) help with all aspects of the children's lives. Leisure activities include a wide range of hobbies, indoor and outdoor pursuits, such as swimming, canoeing, and orienteering. Several playing fields.
